stories.text:
About me: I'm already proficient in C, C++, Javascript, and Scala. I'm expertly adept at Java, Go, and Bash.

I am sold on the idea of Rust, it's awesome. With that said, I've played around with Rust and love it conceptually and philosophically. But whenever I go to learn it or actually start hacking on it, I'm put off and frustrated by the steep learning curve in terms of being able to read and understand Rust programs. The syntax is relatively complex compared to the other languages I know. I consistently end up overwhelmed and give up in frustration. This is just for fun, there isn't a professional driver pushing me to learn it every day.

I'm hoping for something better than "just push through it over and over until it becomes familiar". Learning Go was a pleasure back in 2012, and I wish learning Rust felt similarly empowering.

What is the most efficient path to gaining proficiency in Rust?
stories.title: Ask HN: More pleasant and efficient Path to Learning Rust?
